intro: Erigeron senecio, commonly known as the blueweed or sky-blue aster, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. It features slender stems with hairy leaves and produces showy blue to purple flower heads in the summer. Erigeron senecio is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
